meanings.sent1: The puzzle's reducibility made it easier to solve.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the reducibility of the chemical reaction.
meanings.sent3: The reducibility of the recipe made it perfect for busy weeknights.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was like the reducibility of clay, molding to any situation.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained the reducibility of fractions using simple examples.

meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be simplified or made smaller.
meanings.sent1: The reducibility of the math problem helped the students understand it better.
meanings.sent2: The company focused on the reducibility of their packaging to reduce waste.
meanings.sent3: The reducibility of the joke made everyone laugh at its simplicity.
meanings.sent4: His kindness had a reducibility that could fit into any situation.
meanings.sent5: The artist admired the reducibility of the sculpture, marveling at its simplicity.
